events.name: IoT Summit

venue.name: Moringa School
venue.address_1: Ngong Lane Plaza on Ngong Road

events.description:
The Workshop will deal with the Internet of Things, providing skills and knowledge about the topic and the opportunity to program real boards in order to develop an IoT project.

The event will feature a Session where developers will get hands-on training and Â tracks on relevant technical information on the Internet of Things, Android Things, Google Beacon Platform and the latest microcontroller technologies that they can run their IoT apps on.

They will be Â exposed to fundamentals of EE Basics for web developers ,schematics and simple circuits. Theywill Â learn deeper concepts of areas such as Input and Outputs( Analog and Digital), Serial Communication & Processing, Interfacing (SPI, Web APIs, I2C, RS232, UARTs), Wireless Communication, Data logging(Firebase)/GCP, Internet Integration and Communication e.tc

Target Audience

Newbies, Intermediate and Advanced Developers

University Students

Entrepreneurs

IT staffs from companies and organization in the city

Anyone else who is passionate and interested in Technology space

Anyone with a curiosity for making electronics

People with an intermediate or no experience knowledge of electronics

events.name: Google I/O Extended Nairobi

venue.name: Strathmore University
venue.address_1: Ole Sangale Road

events.description: As the first Google I/O Extended collaboration by GDG Strathmore, GDG USIU, GDG JKUAT and GDG Nairobi weâ€™re super excited to bring together an audience of enthusiasts, developers and creators on the biggest tech event of the year. Our event will contain codelabs, speaker sessions from Google Developer Experts, and a livestream of the keynote speeches. We believe that this event will act as a way for the tech community in Strathmore University to come together to discuss the progress of technology, learn new things and all in all have a piece of the action at I/O in their local community.
events.how_to_find_us: Big, bold, bright signs will deck the entrance of the Strathmore University Auditorium, Ole Sangale Road, Madaraka, Nairobi, Kenya.

events.name: DevFest Nairobi 2017

venue.name: Strathmore University
venue.address_1: Ole Sangale Road

events.description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

Joining thousands all over the world for the greatest series of DevFest events DevFest Nairobi and Central Google Developer Groups are coming together to have the biggest developer event of the year! aimed at familiarizing attendees (who are members of a variety of developer communities) with groundbreaking technology advancements. We will be working closely with Women Techmakers in this devfest season, to continue improving the diversity in our ecosystem. Â Â

venue.name: Moringa School
venue.address_1: Ngong Lane Plaza on Ngong Road

events.description:
â€¢ What we'll do
Study Jams are back! Join us on the 3rd of February for our Google Cloud Study Jam where we'll be taking on:
-Learning how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
-Learning how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.
And at the end of the day you will:
-Get access to Qwiklabs, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
-Get Google-hosted badges for your online profile, to show potential employers what you know about Cloud computing.

â€¢ What to bring
Notebook, Laptop, An open mind.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam ( #1 of 3 )

venue.name: iHub Nairobi
venue.address_1: 6th Floor, Senteu Plaza, Galana / Lenana Road Junction

events.description:
Join us for the Flutter Study Jam Sessions!
Fun, Food, Learning, Badge Earning!

WHAT?
Flutter Study Jams are Community-run study groups based on the Flutter Udacity Course. Participants learn how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.

WHY?
Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn Flutter in person and support them to complete the course. Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

WHO?
Flutter Study Jam is suited best for: 1) those just getting started with mobile app development 2) those with programming experience on other mobile app frameworks.

HOW LONG?
3 in-person sessions to cover 7 hours long Udacity course.
What is the end result?
Create a Flutter app while completing the course, get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge

events.name: [Joint Event] Kotlin/Everywhere Nairobi

venue.name: iHub Nairobi
venue.address_1: 6th Floor, Senteu Plaza, Galana / Lenana Road Junction

events.description:
======================================================================
This is a collaborative event with The Android254 Community.
======================================================================
Want to get started with Kotlin, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Kotlin/Everywhere event.
Together we'll work through several Android / Google Cloud / multi-platform labs. You will get hands-on experience with Kotlin in Android, multi-platform with Kotlin/Native, Google Cloud Platform and Kotlin/JS.

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook). The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Chrome or Firefox installed. Donâ€™t forget your charger!

events.name: TF Lite Codelab [ Pre-TensorFlow Roadshow Nairobi 2019 ]

venue.name: iHub Nairobi
venue.address_1: 6th Floor, Senteu Plaza, Galana / Lenana Road Junction

events.description:
The workshop is a basic codelab so some basic experience with TensorFlow may be good but not necessary. Android experience may be good to have but not necessary. In general the workshop would be most relevant to Software engineers

For attendees of the TensorFlow Lite workshop:

Please follow these steps to prepare a development environment to attend TensorFlow Lite workshop.

Download and install Android Studio 3.4+
https://developer.android.com/studio

Download and create an Android Virtual Device with Android 5.0+. You can use the virtual device images without Google APIs.
https://developer.android.com/studio/run/managing-avds

events.name: TensorFlow Roadshow Nairobi 2019
events.description:
We're gathering top TensorFlow users and machine learning experts in Kenya for a one-day event on Saturday October 5, 2019. The TensorFlow team will be presenting a series of highly technical talks which will inlcude the TensorFlow 2.0 best practices, TF Lite, TF.js, TensorFlow Extended, Model Optimization and much more. Come meet the TensorFlow team, hear what's new, and help us continue to build our developer community!

More - https://events.withgoogle.com/tensorflow-roadshow-nairobi-2019/

events.name: Truecaller Nairobi Developer Meetup

venue.name: Workstyle Serviced Offices  7th Floor
venue.address_1: The Address Building Muthangari Drive  Nairobi, Nairobi County 00606

events.description:
As the startup ecosystem evolves in Africa with growing smartphone penetration and low data costs rapidly, the need of the hour is to plant seeds of scale that will lead to startups/developers delivering successful mobile experiences to the African users.

We in partnership with Workstyle bring an opportunity for startups, entrepreneurs and developers to interact with Truecaller team, learn more and get actionable insights on how one can leverage Truecaller's offering for developers and startups.

We would also be giving exclusive product demo with examples from category leaders leveraging the platform.

To book your seat https://www.eventbrite.com/e/truecaller-nairobi-developer-meetup-tickets-77999317057

AGENDA:
4:45 PM: Registration

5:00 PM: Welcome and Introduction

5:15 PM: Introduction to Truecaller offerings for startups, developers and businesses

5:45PM: A question and answer session open to all

6:00 PM: Panel discussion with startups on all things mobile

6:30 PM: Networking (Connect with Truecaller team and startups over refreshments)

About the Panel Discussion:

About the Panel Discussion:

Moderator - Priyam Bose, Global Head & Director, Developer Platform and Startup Relations at Truecaller (LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/priyam-bose-2373aa9/)

Panelist 1 - Daud Suleiman, CEO & Founder at TOSPAY Limited (LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/msdaudi/)

Panelist 2- Wiza Jalakasi, Head of Global BD & Strategy at Hover Developer Services (LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/wizaj/)

Panelist 3- Selam Ayele Kebede, Director at Antler (LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/selamkebede/)

Panelist 4- Rita Kimani, Co-founder at FarmDrive (LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/ritakimani/

If youâ€™re curious about learning more about Truecaller and how can startups and businesses work with us, donâ€™t miss this exciting event and opportunity. We'll even save some time to take some Q&A from the audience so be sure to get your questions in.

Seats are limited so book your presence now!

events.name: [ ON AIR ] Firebase for Android: Email & Password Authentication with Pius Aboyi
events.description:
Details
Want to get started with Firebase for Android: Email & Password Authentication?

Join us for our virtual Firebase Study Jam!

Together we'll get started with Firebase for Android: Email & Password Authentication with our instructor Pius Aboyi
from GDG Makurdi.

Join the video meeting on GDG Nairobi YouTube Channel:

Discuss, Q/A on Slido:

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

How to build a mobile app with features that enable users sign-up and login using email and password powered by Firebase Authentication service.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED:

Android studio IDE installed on their computer. Windows, Mac or Linux device, everyone is welcome. You will also need a Gmail account to access firebase.

Your own PC, Mac or Chromebook with a good internet connection to join GDG Nairobi Youtube Channel to watch.
